intro: Listrostachys pertusa var. pescatoriana, commonly known as the river sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and aquatic environments. It features slender, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in dense clusters at the base. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in moist soils and is often found along riverbanks and in marshy areas. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
